intro: Madvigia humilis, commonly known as the small madvigia, is a species of flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely known outside of its native range.
